intro: Tibouchina tomentulosa, commonly known as the woolly mint or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its velvety, gray-green foliage and clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Tibouchina tomentulosa is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
